head.title: A Moment for a Man, a Faith and a Campaign

hedline.hl1: A Moment for a Man, a Faith and a Campaign

block.p: Whatever other repercussions the selection of Joseph I. Lieberman as the Democratic vice-presidential candidate may hold for the country (front page, Aug. 8), one significant consequence dare not be overlooked. With this one masterful political move, Al Gore has neutralized -- and trumped -- the cherished rhetoric of Republican discourse in debates over national culture and political norms.

Whatever other repercussions the selection of Joseph I. Lieberman as the Democratic vice-presidential candidate may hold for the country (front page, Aug. 8), one significant consequence dare not be overlooked. With this one masterful political move, Al Gore has neutralized -- and trumped -- the cherished rhetoric of Republican discourse in debates over national culture and political norms.

While the Republicans regularly tout themselves as the saviors of true American ideals fundamentally rooted in Judeo-Christian values, the Democrats now have the only genuine Judeo-Christian ticket in American history! In contrast to abstract Republican pieties, Democrats can boast of ''the real thing.'' What a stunningly simple yet breathtaking turn of events.
BENNY KRAUT West Hempstead, N.Y., Aug. 8, 2000
The writer is director of the Center for Jewish Studies at Queens College.
